news.title: 10 Things You Can Do with MetaMask Portfolio
news.subtitle: Whether you‚Äôre an OG or newbie, the Fox is here to make you more powerful in web3. Here are 10 things you can do today in MetaMask Portfolio.

image.title: 10 Things You Can Do with MetaMask Portfolio

childMarkdownRemark.html:
The MetaMask wallet has been around almost as long as web3 itself. Launched in 2016, the Fox has come a long way since then, guided by a mission to connect as many people around the world to the decentralized internet as possible. And we know connecting is just the start - much more than that MetaMask enables you to buy, sell, swap, bridge, stake, and beyond, and it all starts in Portfolio.

MetaMask Portfolio is where you get a clear, comprehensive view of your accounts and wallets across all networks. It‚Äôs also where your web3 journey begins. Whether you‚Äôve been using MetaMask for years or even minutes, here are ten things you can do in Portfolio right now:

Ten ways MetaMask Portfolio makes you powerful in web3


1. Manage your digital assets and track performance in the dashboard: Easily view and manage all your digital assets including Ethereum tokens (ERC-20) and non-fungible tokens (NFTs), all from a single, unified interface. Keep an eye on your portfolio's performance over time, with insights into asset distribution, historical transactions, and overall value trends. Remember you can view the balances of any public Ethereum address or ENS. You can also view which airdrops you‚Äôre eligible for by using the claim airdrop feature.

How to use the Dashboard on MetaMask Portfolio:




2. Do your taxes: Yes, that‚Äôs correct ‚Äì you can do your crypto taxes directly from Portfolio. All you have to do is connect your wallet and you‚Äôll receive 10% off your tax services with recommended providers like CoinTracker, CoinLedger, ZenLedger, Crypto Tax Calculator, and Koinly:


3. Connect to dapps and explore web3: Access and engage with all the dapps web3 has to offer directly through Portfolio: from decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms like Aave, Uniswap, and Renzo, gaming dapps such as HyperPlay to NFT marketplaces like OpenSea.

4. Swap tokens: Use the built-in swap feature to trade tokens directly within Portfolio, leveraging the best available rates across multiple decentralized exchanges (DEXs).



5. Connect to multiple networks: Beyond Ethereum, MetaMask supports various Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)-compatible networks, allowing users to switch between networks like Binance Smart Chain, Polygon, Linea, and more.

6. Buy and sell cryptocurrency: Buy cryptocurrencies directly within MetaMask Portfolio using traditional payment methods such as bank transfers or credit cards, and through integrations with third-party providers like Paypal and Revoult. And if you‚Äôre ready to sell, Portfolio has you covered, simply connect your wallet and select your method to cash out.




7. Integrate with your hardware wallet: Enhance your security by connecting MetaMask to hardware wallets like Ledger or Trezor from Portfolio, combining the convenience of MetaMask with the robust security of cold storage.

8. Customize privacy settings: Adjust your privacy settings to your preference, including setting up a custom RPC for specific networks, managing connected sites, and reviewing permissions. Learn more about how to configure your privacy settings here.

9. Participate in staking: Stake your crypto directly through MetaMask Portfolio, participating in the decision-making processes of various protocols and earning rewards. In Portfolio, there are three options for staking, Validator, Pooled, and Liquid. The below tutorials show you how easy it is to start staking based on your preference.




10. Bridge tokens: Bridging tokens on MetaMask refers to the process of transferring digital assets or tokens from one blockchain network to another using MetaMask as the interface for the transaction. Bridging tokens is a powerful feature in Portfolio that enhances the interoperability between different blockchain networks, enabling users to leverage the unique advantages of each network.


Coming soon in Portfolio


Transfer assets from centralized exchanges (CEXs) like Coinbase and Binance directly to your MetaMask wallet, or between different accounts within MetaMask itself, with enhanced security and ease. Stay tuned for this feature coming soon in Portfolio.

MetaMask Portfolio not only simplifies the management of digital assets but also opens up a world of possibilities for users to explore and engage with the decentralized ecosystem, all while maintaining a high level of security and user control. Get started today.

news.title: Introducing MetaMask Card:  Upgrade Your Crypto Spending
news.subtitle: With MetaMask Card, users can now spend their crypto anywhere Mastercard is accepted. This pilot is available to a limited group of users in the EU and UK only.

image.title: Introducing MetaMask Card:  Upgrade Your Crypto Spending Image

childMarkdownRemark.html:
In an exciting development for crypto natives and everyday consumers alike, MetaMask, Mastercard, and Baanx (Crypto Life) have launched the pilot of MetaMask Card - the world's first Mastercard payment card that enables direct spending from your MetaMask wallet. Eligible users can now make everyday purchases with their crypto anywhere Mastercard is accepted.

‚ÄúMetaMask Card pilot gives people more freedom to spend their crypto,‚Äù says Lorenzo Santos, Senior Product Manager at Consensys. ‚ÄúMetaMask Card represents a major step to removing the friction that has traditionally existed between the blockchain and real-world commerce. This is a paradigm shift that offers the best of both worlds.‚Äù

In line with this, Chief Commercial Officer at Baanx, Simon Jones says, ‚ÄúWe are so delighted to partner with web3‚Äôs leading wallet, MetaMask, to power the financial revolution by enabling users to be their own bank.‚Äù

This pilot is available to a limited group of users in the EU and UK only. To find out if you're eligible, simply go to your MetaMask Portfolio and check if you have a "Card" tab in the navigation bar on the left side. Eligible users with the Card tab will be redirected to the Crypto Life platform to set up their account and card.

Accelerating Crypto Adoption by Removing Barriers to Spending

For too long, the process of spending crypto in the real world has been cumbersome and often requires jumping through several hoops like sending funds to an exchange, transferring it to a bank, and only then being able to spend. This tedious user journey has hindered mainstream adoption of crypto as a practical, real-world currency.

MetaMask Card upgrades this experience by eliminating the need for a bank to spend your crypto. This not only paves the way for increased adoption, it also aligns with the MetaMask vision of empowering people with self-custody.

Most traditional crypto cards operate similarly to prepaid cards, where one must transfer funds to a third party before spending them.

What makes the MetaMask Card unique is that it functions like a debit card. This means card holders can directly use the crypto in their MetaMask wallet for everyday purchases and maintain control over their funds until the exact moment of payment. MetaMask Card utilizes Mastercard's global merchant network, combined with the security of MetaMask and the efficiency of Linea secured by the Ethereum network. This trio brings a swift, cost-effective, and secure spending experience, whether online or for in store purchases.

A Phased Launch to Global Expansion of the MetaMask Card

The pilot phase is kicking off in the EU and the UK, offering a few thousand users the chance to sign up for a MetaMask Card, which includes integration with Apple Pay or Google Pay for immediate use. Eligible currencies at launch include USDC, USDT, and WETH on Linea.

Go to MetaMask Portfolio and check for the "Card" tab to see if you‚Äôre eligible. If you are, check out Getting Started with MetaMask Card for easy instructions on how to set up and use your card.

If you are not eligible during the pilot phase, but would like to be notified when you might be in the future, fill out this form.

Looking ahead, MetaMask Card is set to expand its reach, with plans for geographic expansion into additional regions. Stay tuned for more updates on MetaMask Card.

news.title: Powerful, Configurable, Secure: MetaMask is How You Show Up in Web3
news.subtitle: No matter who you are or how you use web3, MetaMask allows you to do more safely on the decentralized internet

image.title: Powerful, Configurable, Secure: MetaMask is How You Show Up in Web3 Image

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Web3 is catalyzing global change and as a MetaMask user, you're leading the charge. You are a trendsetter, trailblazer, creator, and builder, defining and shaping the culture and the systems that will define the next age of the decentralized internet.

Over the years, we‚Äôve built MetaMask to be a wallet without limits, designed for anyone who wants to do more with their crypto, engage with more dapps, and do it more safely. With MetaMask, there are no dead ends, no corner of web3 you can't explore, no dapp you can't connect with. And thanks to its best-in-class security, infinite extensibility, and powerful aggregation and curation in Portfolio, there's never been a better time for you to do more with MetaMask.

Let‚Äôs explore further.

MetaMask Makes You More Powerful in Web3

MetaMask is your gateway to the decentralized web, offering unmatched connectivity to thousands of dapps across networks and devices. It enables users to self-custody their assets, securely manage their digital authority and confidently sign transactions on the web, on the go or natively in a dapp.

MetaMask also brings the best of web3 to you. Instead of building ‚Äúone size fits all‚Äù tools, we aggregate the best web3 bridges, DEXs, onramp providers and staking protocols so you can choose the best tool for the job and manage your assets, without ever leaving the wallet.

Users can effortlessly buy, sell, swap, send, trade and stake tokens, knowing they‚Äôre getting the best rates from dozens of trusted providers.

Configurability, Privacy, and Extensibility: More Control with MetaMask

MetaMask is also pushing the boundaries of user control, offering unmatched configurability. We didn‚Äôt build a ‚Äútake it or leave it‚Äù wallet, instead shaping MetaMask as a customizable extension of you. MetaMask, allows users to set the terms for how applications can interact with their self-custodied data and digital assets.

Nowhere is this configurability more important than with our privacy features that allow users to control even the most basic functionality of the MetaMask wallet - from RPC configuration and token management to custom security warnings and IP tracking. The default settings built into MetaMask to protect users are all configurable, because there is no one size fits all approach to privacy.

Customize your privacy settings:

Extend to any network:

Set your terms:

Configurability is not limited to just what the MetaMask team has built. With MetaMask Snaps, users can tailor their experience, extend MetaMask to new networks and even build their own extensions and customizations, without permission - that's permissionless innovation.

Do Everything in Web3 More Securely with MetaMask

None of this matters if users do not feel secure exploring the frontiers of web3. MetaMask is committed to security and has become the battle-tested wallet trusted by millions of users executing their largest and most sensitive transactions.

We have powered billions of transactions across thousands of networks and scores of dapps, without security incidents caused by MetaMask and offer support to our customers 24/7 to ensure they safely navigate web3.

We are constantly investing in security, striking new partnerships like Blockaid's transaction security, adding new capabilities through the team at Wallet Guard, enabling users to build a modular wallet through Snaps and even building runtime protection through our Lavamoat security kernel. And with an open-source codebase and a transparent approach to privacy, you know exactly what you‚Äôre using with MetaMask.

MetaMask, an Extension of You in Web3 Now and Always

As the momentum of regulatory clarity and mainstream interest spurs innovation in our space, MetaMask will continue to be the powerful, configurable, secure wallet for those building and exploring the frontiers of the decentralized internet.

With powerful aggregators that put the best of tools in crypto at your fingertips and configurable settings that put you in control of your assets, data and digital authority, and a steadfast commitment to security and privacy preservation - MetaMask enables you to do more, safely, in web3.

And we‚Äôre just getting started.

This post is directed only at persons outside the UK and should not be acted on by UK consumers.

news.title: We hosted a group of artists together in Miami during Art Basel to discuss the state of NFTs. Here‚Äôs what we learned.
news.subtitle: 22 artists gathered at MetaMask‚Äôs inaugural Artist Potluck for an unforgettable evening.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
As the sun set one evening in bustling Miami during Art Basel week, some of web3‚Äôs most influential and talented NFT artists gathered at El Tuc√°n restaurant for MetaMask‚Äôs inaugural Artist Potluck.

The theme for the night was ‚ÄúConstellation‚Äù as MetaMask brought some of the brightest stars in the NFT space together for connection, camaraderie, and creativity. The atmosphere was filled with excitement and anticipation, as the artists enjoyed delicious food, drinks, and dialogue.

This was no ordinary potluck. Instead of bringing a dish to share, each artist came to the table with an NFT gift for one another. NFTs were minted on Manifold. By the end of the night, every artist left with a unique piece of art they could view in their MetaMask account, just in time for the giving season. Take a look at the stunning Constellation collection here: https://opensea.io/collection/constellation-artist-potluck

A prominent artist herself, and our very own community builder, Faith Love was all smiles as she hosted and greeted the ecstatic creators. If you get a chance, ask her about the tablecloth, we heard it was her favorite piece of the night. üòâ

Joe Lubin, Co-Founder of Ethereum and CEO of ConsenSys kicked off the festivities with a toast to the creators.

Besides spoiling the artists with a decadent dinner replete with black truffle pizzetta, sushi platters, woodfired wagyu beef tomahawk, and so much more (they were surprised each time a new course was served), drinks and entertainment were ever-flowing. We even had a designer, Tara Moves, sketch the event in real-time:

Chatting with the artists

We could rave on about the night but you don‚Äôt have to take our word for it. We had the pleasure of interviewing some of the creators in attendance: Bryan Brinkman, Stonez, Kira Bursky, Ant Pantone, Aaron Ricketts, and Angel. It was refreshing to hear their thoughts about art, technology, community, and the future of NFTs.

They all chose to become NFT artists for a variety of reasons, including the potential for royalties and perpetual income, the ability to connect with other artists, and the desire for more control and freedom in their work.

‚ÄúFor artists, it‚Äôs a whole new revenue stream that‚Äôs emerged. I have friends through Twitter that are artists who were previously not working full time that are now because of the NFTs,‚Äù said Kira Bursky, a filmmaker and multidisciplinary artist.

Many of them cited the potential for NFTs to allow them to support themselves through their art and invest in other artists' creative journeys. Overall, the decision to become an NFT artist seems to be driven by a combination of financial and artistic considerations.

Bryan Brinkman is a digital artist that specializes in animation and cartoon art. ‚ÄúTo me, NFT offers a closer connection to the artist. When you collect a piece of art from Art Basel you might not have a personal connection with that artist, you might have bought it from a gallery. With NFTs, you‚Äôre able to talk directly to the artist, have a connection, and be invested in their journey and growth. You can watch them flourish in this space, which you can do with traditional art to an extent, but it‚Äôs not as easy to do on a massive scale like it is with NFTs‚Ä¶. Connecting with this community is the most fun part of this space.‚Äù

While artist Aaron Ricketts‚Äî photographer, visual artist, and self-proclaimed realistic surrealist‚Äîsaid, ‚ÄúEverything about [NFTs] is exciting. Whether it‚Äôs photographers, painters, music artists, people are taking more control over what they create and what they put out into the world. Cutting out the middleman and making it about the art again. That‚Äôs important because artists now are shining in ways they may not have.‚Äù

It hit closer to home for Stonez, a musician and digital artist who addressed the key reasons that drew him to the space: being able to protect yourself as an artist, having your family be able to reap the benefits of your art, and how the blockchain protects that.

‚ÄúIn a traditional art world there are too many instances where an artist doesn‚Äôt get their recognition till after they die, but also their family isn‚Äôt able to reap the benefits of that because there's no trace, but on-chain‚Äîwith splits and royalties‚Äîyour family can [benefit] forever [from] your creations.‚Äù

Besides MetaMask being their favorite wallet, it was interesting to observe how these artists shared a similar sentiment when it came to their favorite part about minting an NFT‚Äîthe excitement, joy of sharing it with the world, and the ensuing butterflies once live.

Their favorite part about owning an NFT was supporting other artists‚Äîfriends and internet strangers alike‚Äîand they quickly declared how rewarding it is to cheer on other creators as a buyer: to invest in their growth and watch them flourish. As Bryan Brinkman put it, ‚ÄúConnecting with this community is the most fun part of this space.‚Äù

Much of the creative process involves being in the flow, or ‚Äúin the zone,‚Äù a mental state in which a person is fully immersed and focused on the action of making art. When asked about his creative process, Aaron Ricketts, explained it‚Äôs more about just living in the flow and reaching his nirvana in the day-to-day. Instead of forcing it, Aaron places an emphasis on observing the world.

‚ÄúPart of that is practicing abundance mentality and understanding things are okay even when they may not be okay. Understanding when it comes to creativity and doing things, it‚Äôs not really something you have to do. It's something that happens and naturally occurs.‚Äù

Kira Bursky felt similar when she noted, ‚ÄúEverything I create is very subconscious and I let it happen. I'm along for the ride. I don‚Äôt know where it‚Äôs going to take me, but it generally stems from some core feeling in my body, a sensation, and I just see what metaphor is going to play out from that visually.‚Äù

The group of artists was very diverse with music, canvas, digital, motion, and poetry as their respective mediums, having something to say to the world, and themselves.

With Angel‚Äôs art, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs telling people to be happy,‚Äù stemming from her own personal struggles with mental health.

True ownership and the future of NFTs

It sometimes feels like NFT artists are overlooked when it comes to the ‚Äútech side‚Äù of crypto, but more often than not, they are deep proponents of core web3 principles like true ownership and security. Artists, more than degen traders, seem to realize the importance of self-custody.

When Ant Pantone‚Äîan artist with both analog and digital approaches‚Äîwas asked about this, he didn‚Äôt hesitate to repeat the mantra, not your keys, not your coins.

‚ÄúMetaMask gives me the financial independence that I need. I don‚Äôt need to be run by a bank. I own my keys. I love [MetaMask] security and communication.‚Äù

A strong preference for self-custody is a sentiment we feel will be adopted by more people. This is the silver lining during the recent insolvency of big CeFi players: more people are asking important questions and taking a closer look at the security of their assets to make informed decisions.

Where does one start with their self-custody journey? Education. Whether you‚Äôre an artist, DeFi dabbler, or tech veteran‚Äîyou can download MetaMask, the wallet that gives you the freedom to exit anytime, for any reason.

We closed our conversations out on a fun note, asking each artist to describe the future of NFTs in three words:

MetaMask‚Äôs inaugural Artist Potluck in Miami hearkened back to ages of old when brilliant minds would come together over dinner and drinks, and talk about their art and what inspires them. Only this time, the medium was enhanced with blockchain technology.

Thank you to all the artists who showed up and continue sharing their creations with the world. This community wouldn‚Äôt be the same without you. Special thanks to Faith Love for hosting and curating such an electric evening. It was an unforgettable night, and we can‚Äôt wait to do it all again.

news.title: How to build a user feedback loop into your web3 dapp
news.subtitle: Build a user feedback form into your web3 dapp.

image.title: How to build a user feedback loop into your web3 dapp image

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Collecting user feedback is one of the most critical steps to achieving product-market-fit and creating a successful application. And it‚Äôs even more important in web3, where standards for UX design are still emerging and undefined.

For web3 developers, the most popular method of collecting user feedback about their dapps continues to be centralized solutions offered by companies like Google and Mailchimp. However, on-chain feedback forms are now available. Let‚Äôs look at these web3-native feedback forms, why they‚Äôre important to your dapp‚Äôs success, and how to use them.

In a previous post, we introduced Form-xChange: a new open-source, decentralized web3 form built by Consensys, and showed you how to integrate it into your dapp using the MetaMask SDK.

In this tutorial, we‚Äôll build on these steps by showing you how to deploy a feedback form to your frontend and create a new form for users to share their input about your dapp. But first, a quick reminder on the importance of collecting user feedback for product development and management.

Web3 user feedback forms to help mass adoption


Native, decentralized feedback forms are desperately needed in web3. Why?

  1. They cut costs dramatically: The only (and one-time) cost associated with creating a form is during the deployment of a smart contract. And if deployed on an L2 like Linea, the cost is usually not more than a few dollars.
  2. They have near-infinite customization possibilities: You can design your form to collect any kind of feedback you wish (text, reactions, links, etc.). Additionally, you can customize your frontend as needed as it is completely distinct from the contract.
  3. You pay only for what you use: With decentralized forms, there are no payment tiers based on the number of responses. Theoretically, you can record as many responses as you want. \

If you‚Äôre adopting a model where customers pay gas, you won‚Äôt incur any cost beyond contract deployment.
If you choose to pay the bill on behalf of your customers, again the cost is a few cents when you‚Äôre operating on a cost-efficient network. 4. You can implement token gating: Using decentralized forms, you can gate access to who can respond to your form questions. Therefore, you could theoretically limit access to wallets who own NFTs from your collection, wallets that have a certain non-zero balance of ETH, or an ERC-20 token of your choice.

A tutorial: creating your own decentralized user feedback form


Step 1: Install MetaMask


We will be deploying and interacting with our contracts on Linea. In order to do this, we will require a crypto wallet that is configured with the Linea network and has a small balance of LineaETH.

You first need a web3 wallet. In this tutorial we‚Äôll use MetaMask ‚Äî a free, easy to use wallet that comes automatically configured with Linea. You can install MetaMask as an extension for your browser here.

Note: For this tutorial, we recommend using a browser other than Brave (for example, Edge, Chrome, Safari, etc.). At the time of writing, Form-xChange has known issues running on the Brave browser.

Once you‚Äôve added the extension, MetaMask will prompt you to complete a series of steps, including giving you your wallet recovery phrase. Store this phrase carefully. If lost, you can‚Äôt recover it. If stolen, someone else will have access to your funds.

Once your wallet is set up, navigate to the network drop-down in the top left of the MetaMask extension and toggle show test networks on. From the new drop-down, select the Linea Goerli network. If all goes well, your wallet should look something like this:

Step 2: Acquire LineaETH from a faucet

If this is your first time working with Linea, your wallet will (obviously) have a balance of 0 LineaETH.

Let‚Äôs change that. Infura has a faucet that gives you access to free 0.5 LineaETH every day. In order to access this faucet, you may be prompted to create a free Infura account.

Once the top up is done, you should see a small LineaETH balance:

Step 3: Acquire a Linea RPC endpoint


Sign into Infura again using the account you created in the previous step. You will automatically be redirected to the main dashboard.

Here, create a new project by creating a new API key on the top right.

For network, choose web3 API. You can name the key anything you want.

Once your key is created, you will be redirected once again to a project dashboard containing a collection of endpoints. From here, take note of the endpoint associated with Linea testnet. We will require this in a later step to deploy our Form-xChange contracts.

Step 4: Install node and npm


The Form-xChange solution runs on a stack of Infura, Next.js, Truffle, and the Dapp API. In order to install and use these technologies, we‚Äôll need node and npm on our local machine.

You can download both for your operating system here.

Once done, check that it has been installed correctly by checking their version numbers on your terminal.

$ node -v
$ npm -v

Step 5: Clone the Form-xChange repository

As mentioned earlier, Form-xChange is an open-source repository whose source code is publicly available on GitHub.

Let‚Äôs clone this repository and install all required packages using the following commands:

$ git clone https://github.com/Consensys/Form-XChange
$ cd Form-XChange
$ npm install

Open the Form-xChange repository in your favorite code editor (e.g. VS Code). This is a turn-key project, so we won‚Äôt need to write much code apart from configuring a few environment variables.

Step 6: Deploy the feedback form


Navigate to the sub-folder containing the Truffle project and the form smart contracts:

$ cd packages/form-XChange

In this folder, you will see a contracts sub-folder that contains two main contracts: a FeedbackForm and a FeedbackFormFactory.

The former implements an individual form that is capable of storing a list of questions and responses made to those questions.

The latter is a factory contract that can be used to deploy customized versions of the former.

You can take a look at the source code and make modifications according to the kind of form that you want to create. For this tutorial, we‚Äôll stick to the default configuration.

In this step, we are going to deploy the FeedbackFormFactory contract. This will allow us, the creator, to create forms from our Next frontend.

In order to do this, create a file named .env and add the following information:

MNEMONIC = "< YOUR WALLET RECOVERY PHRASE >"

Next, in the truffle-config.js file, replace the generic RPC endpoint with the Infura endpoint you generated in Step 3. The final config file should look something like this:

require("dotenv").config();
const mnemonic = process.env["MNEMONIC"];

const HDWalletProvider = require("@truffle/hdwallet-provider");

module.exports = {
  networks: {
    development: {
      host: "127.0.0.1", // Localhost
      port: 9545,
      network_id: "5777",
      chain_id: 1337,
    },
    linea: {
      provider: () =>
        new HDWalletProvider(mnemonic, `< INFURA LINEA ENDPOINT >`),
      network_id: 59140,
      chain_id: 59140,
    },
  },
  mocha: {
    timeout: 100000,
  },
  compilers: {
    solc: {
      version: "0.8.13",
    },
  },
};

We‚Äôre all set! Deploy the feedback form factory contract by running the following command:

$ npm run linea

If all goes well you should see output that looks something like this:

> form-xchange@0.0.0 linea
> npm run compile && npm run generate-types && npm run migrate:linea

> form-xchange@0.0.0 compile
> truffle compile

Compiling your contracts...
===========================
> Everything is up to date, there is nothing to compile.

> form-xchange@0.0.0 generate-types
> typechain --target=truffle-v5 'build/contracts/*.json'

Successfully generated 5 typings!

> form-xchange@0.0.0 migrate:linea
> truffle migrate --network linea

Compiling your contracts...
===========================
> Everything is up to date, there is nothing to compile.

Starting migrations...
======================
> Network name:    'linea'
> Network id:      59140
> Block gas limit: 61000000 (0x3a2c940)

1_deploy_contracts.js
=====================

   Replacing 'FeedbackFormFactory'
   -------------------------------
   > transaction hash:    0x50ba2c362cb463d0b763ba5f092e3f1a8591dd9cd358f2feda035438ce02cee0
   > Blocks: 2            Seconds: 21
   > contract address:    0xBDAb1F857dC80968022784cc1C868820BFD2F7c5
   > block number:        1099121
   > block timestamp:     1688991002
   > account:             0xc361Fc33b99F88612257ac8cC2d852A5CEe0E217
   > balance:             0.62878173171592041
   > gas used:            2636875 (0x283c4b)
   > gas price:           2.500000007 gwei
   > value sent:          0 ETH
   > total cost:          0.006592187518458125 ETH

   > Saving artifacts
   -------------------------------------

Summary
=======
> Total deployments:   1
> Final cost:          0.006592187518458125 ETH

Take note of the contract address. We‚Äôll need this in a later step.

Step 7: Deploy the Next frontend factory

With our feedback form factory contract live, let‚Äôs shift our attention to the Next frontend. Navigate to the Next app project by running the following command:

$ cd ../../apps/web

We‚Äôll need to connect our app with the contract we deployed in the previous step. We can do so by opening the lib/contract.ts/config.ts file and adding the contract address.

Without writing almost any code, we have deployed an entire decentralized form solution for our dapp and gained the ability to not just capture user feedback, but to capture it in a decentralized, web3-native form.
